creditline: Lent by Curtis Galleries, Inc., Minneapolis, MN
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: painted and carved wood house post; a woman holding a three tier set of baskets on her head kneels on the head of a man riding a horse and carrying a large knife in his proper left hand; 3 mounts accompanying object 1 from dealer, 1 MIA, and 1 from the Smithsonian; wooden mount L4.3 MS
text: Most of the African master carvers remain unidentified. But some artists are known, and are still remembered and celebrated today. Olowe of Ise is one of them. He made this post for a Yoruba royal palace, where it supported the roof of a veranda lining the kingâ€™s reception courtyard. The two-tiered composition depicts a traditional priest mounted on a horse and a kneeling female caryatid.
title: Veranda post
